contentrichtext.text: '''Ian Hyland''' (born 23 September 1969, brought up in [[Chesterfield]], [[Derbyshire]]) is an English [[television]] [[critic]]. ==Journalism career== Hyland wrote a [[columnist|column]] for the [[Sunday Mirror]] from 2000 to 2005. Until 2011 closure of the newspaper, he wrote for the ''[[News of the World]]''. He currently writes for the Daily Mail. He has been billed as "the TV critic with the [[widescreen]] mouth" due to his outspoken, self-assertive style. ==Television== Hyland appeared on [[Five (TV)|Five]]'s ''[[The Wright Stuff]]'' as a regular guest from 2003 to 2005. He returned to the show in April 2010 appearing every Friday to preview television programmes for the week ahead<ref>[http://www3.five.tv/thewrightstuffonfive/friday-23rd-april Friday 23rd April] ''The Wright Stuff'' - five.tv</ref> before being replaced by Kevin O'Sullivan.
